title: Understanding Hepatitis -- Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: It's possible you might have hepatitis and not realize it at first. Sometimes there aren't any symptoms. Or you might not get the right diagnosis because the disease shares some of the same signs as the flu.
The most common symptoms of hepatitis are things like:
Some people have other issues, such as:
bullets: Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes )
Mental changes, such as stupor (being in a daze) or coma

content_blocks.text: It's possible you might have hepatitis and not realize it at first. Sometimes there aren't any symptoms. Or you might not get the right diagnosis because the disease shares some of the same signs as the flu.
The most common symptoms of hepatitis are things like:
Some people have other issues, such as:
associated_bullets: Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes )
Mental changes, such as stupor (being in a daze) or coma

sections.heading: When to See Your Doctor
content: Always check with your doctor if you have any of the signs of hepatitis. If you don't get treatment it can lead to cirrhosis , a serious scarring of your liver .
Also make an appointment if a friend or member of your family comes down with the disease. There's a risk you could get infected, too.
Be on the lookout for symptoms of hepatitis if you travel to a country where the disease is common. Call your doctor if you think you're showing any signs.
